title: Lack of New Bond Supply Likely to Support Euro IG Corporate Debt
body: 0923 GMT - Limited supply of new bonds is likely to support euro-denominated investment-grade corporate bond spreads Monday, says Commerzbank. “Muted primary market activity gave euro investment-grade cash spreads some breathing space [Friday]” and “with most of Europe away and the U.S. data calendar also empty, the more constructive market backdrop could expand today,” says credit strategist Cem Keltek. Today is a public holiday in some European countries, which is expected to weigh on sales of new corporate bonds. (lorena.ruibal@wsj.com)
